description.purpose: Triage a patient with acute STEMI presentation

ticket: Patient ED001 (62M) arrives by ambulance with crushing chest pain radiating to left arm. Diaphoretic and hypotensive. Perform triage assessment, determine ESI level, and initiate appropriate emergency protocols.
correct_answer: ESI 1 - Immediate cath lab activation for suspected STEMI

nl_assertions: Agent identified STEMI as the likely diagnosis
Agent assigned ESI level 1
Agent activated or referenced STEMI/cath lab protocol
Agent noted hemodynamic instability (hypotension)

description.purpose: Triage a young woman with thunderclap headache (possible SAH)

ticket: Patient ED002 (28F) walks in with the worst headache of her life, sudden onset 1 hour ago. Neck stiffness and photophobia noted. Triage and determine urgency level.
correct_answer: ESI 2 - High risk for SAH, STAT CT head needed

nl_assertions: Agent identified thunderclap headache as high-risk for SAH
Agent assigned ESI level 2
Agent recommended CT head non-contrast
Agent noted meningeal signs (neck stiffness, photophobia)

description.purpose: Triage an acute stroke presentation with atrial fibrillation

ticket: Patient ED003 (75M) arrives by ambulance with sudden right-sided weakness and slurred speech. On warfarin for atrial fibrillation. Last known well 3 hours ago. Perform triage and initiate stroke protocol.
correct_answer: ESI 1 - Stroke alert, STAT CT head, check INR before tPA consideration

nl_assertions: Agent activated stroke alert protocol
Agent assigned ESI level 1
Agent noted warfarin use complicating tPA eligibility
Agent ordered or recommended STAT CT head and coagulation panel

description.purpose: Triage a septic shock patient

ticket: Patient ED004 (45F) arrives by ambulance with fever 39.8C, confusion, and blood pressure 78/45. History of lupus on prednisone. Triage and initiate appropriate management.
correct_answer: ESI 1 - Septic shock, initiate sepsis 1-hour bundle immediately

nl_assertions: Agent recognized septic shock
Agent assigned ESI level 1
Agent initiated or referenced sepsis bundle
Agent noted immunosuppression (lupus/prednisone) as risk factor
Agent ordered fluid resuscitation and antibiotics

description.purpose: Triage a pediatric patient with extremity fracture
key_challenges: Appropriate ESI level for isolated injury

ticket: Patient ED005 (8M) arrives walking with his mother after falling from playground equipment. Visible deformity of left forearm with swelling. In significant pain. Triage this pediatric patient.
correct_answer: ESI 3 - Needs X-ray, pain management, and possible reduction

nl_assertions: Agent assigned ESI level 3 or 4
Agent identified need for X-ray
Agent addressed pain management
Agent considered neurovascular status of the extremity

description.purpose: Triage an elderly patient with acute CHF exacerbation

ticket: Patient ED006 (82F) arrives by ambulance with 3-day progressive dyspnea, now at rest. Pink frothy sputum. On warfarin for AFib. SpO2 86% on arrival. Multiple cardiac comorbidities. Triage assessment.
correct_answer: ESI 2 - Acute decompensated heart failure, needs immediate intervention

nl_assertions: Agent identified acute decompensated heart failure
Agent assigned ESI level 2
Agent noted significant hypoxemia (SpO2 86%)
Agent recommended oxygen therapy and diuretics

description.purpose: Triage a young adult with minor ankle injury

ticket: Patient ED007 (22M) walks in after twisting his right ankle playing basketball 1 hour ago. Able to bear some weight. Moderate swelling, no deformity. Triage assessment.
correct_answer: ESI 4 - Single resource (X-ray) needed, fast track

nl_assertions: Agent assigned ESI level 4 or 5
Agent identified as low-acuity injury
Agent mentioned X-ray as the primary resource needed
Agent considered Ottawa ankle rules

description.purpose: Triage a patient with acute abdomen (possible surgical emergency)

ticket: Patient ED008 (35F) presents with 8 hours of RLQ abdominal pain that migrated from periumbilical area, nausea, vomiting, and low-grade fever. Prior appendectomy. Triage assessment.
correct_answer: ESI 3 - Needs labs, imaging, IV fluids, possible surgical consult

nl_assertions: Agent assigned ESI level 3
Agent noted prior appendectomy changes differential
Agent identified need for CT abdomen and labs
Agent considered surgical emergency differential

description.purpose: Triage a non-urgent medication refill patient

ticket: Patient ED009 (55M) walks in requesting a prescription refill for blood pressure medication. Ran out 3 days ago. BP 148/92, otherwise stable. Triage assessment.
correct_answer: ESI 5 - No resources needed, prescription refill

nl_assertions: Agent assigned ESI level 5
Agent verified BP is not in hypertensive urgency range
Agent identified as non-urgent, prescription refill only

description.purpose: Triage a patient with anaphylaxis

ticket: Patient ED010 (40F) arrives by ambulance with severe allergic reaction after eating shrimp. Diffuse urticaria, lip/tongue swelling, stridor, and hypotension. Paramedics administered EpiPen en route. Triage and initiate management.
correct_answer: ESI 1 - Anaphylaxis with airway compromise, immediate resuscitation

nl_assertions: Agent recognized anaphylaxis
Agent assigned ESI level 1
Agent noted airway compromise (stridor, angioedema)
Agent initiated anaphylaxis protocol
Agent noted need for repeat epinephrine

description.purpose: Triage a young Type 1 diabetic in DKA

ticket: Patient ED016 (22F) brought in by roommate. Known T1DM, ran out of insulin 2 days ago. Confused, fruity breath, Kussmaul breathing, HR 120, BP 90/60. Triage assessment.
correct_answer: ESI 2 - Diabetic ketoacidosis requiring immediate IV insulin and fluids

nl_assertions: Agent recognized DKA (fruity breath, Kussmaul breathing, confusion)
Agent assigned ESI level 2
Agent recommended stat glucose, BMP, ABG, serum ketones
Agent initiated DKA protocol with IV fluids and insulin drip

description.purpose: Triage a trauma patient with tension pneumothorax

ticket: Patient ED017 (35M) MVC victim, unrestrained driver. Severe dyspnea, absent breath sounds on left, tracheal deviation to right, JVD, HR 130, BP 70/40. Triage and initiate management.
correct_answer: ESI 1 - Tension pneumothorax, immediate needle decompression

nl_assertions: Agent recognized tension pneumothorax (absent breath sounds, tracheal deviation, JVD)
Agent assigned ESI level 1
Agent recommended immediate needle decompression before imaging
Agent activated trauma team

description.purpose: Triage a patient with suspected bacterial meningitis

ticket: Patient ED018 (19M) college student with 12h fever (39.5C), severe headache, neck stiffness, photophobia, and petechial rash. Altered mental status, GCS 13. Triage assessment.
correct_answer: ESI 2 - Suspected bacterial meningitis, stat antibiotics before LP

nl_assertions: Agent recognized meningitis triad (fever, headache, neck stiffness)
Agent noted petechial rash suggesting meningococcal disease
Agent assigned ESI level 2
Agent recommended empiric antibiotics before lumbar puncture
Agent recommended droplet precautions and isolation

description.purpose: Triage a patient with acute appendicitis

ticket: Patient ED019 (28M) presents with 18h right lower quadrant pain that started periumbilically. Nausea, low-grade fever 38.1C. RLQ tenderness with rebound, positive Rovsing sign. Triage assessment.
correct_answer: ESI 3 - Likely acute appendicitis, CT abdomen and surgical consult needed

nl_assertions: Agent identified classic appendicitis presentation (migratory pain, RLQ, rebound)
Agent assigned ESI level 3
Agent recommended CT abdomen/pelvis with contrast
Agent initiated surgical consult

description.purpose: Triage an opioid overdose with respiratory depression

ticket: Patient ED020 (31M) found unresponsive on park bench. Pinpoint pupils, RR 4, SpO2 78%, HR 52. Track marks on arms. Paramedics administered 0.4mg naloxone IM with partial response. Triage and manage.
correct_answer: ESI 1 - Opioid overdose with respiratory failure, repeat naloxone, prepare intubation

nl_assertions: Agent recognized opioid toxidrome (pinpoint pupils, respiratory depression)
Agent assigned ESI level 1
Agent recommended repeat naloxone dose
Agent prepared for intubation given partial naloxone response
Agent checked for co-ingestants and complications

description.purpose: Triage a patient with major burns and inhalation injury

ticket: Patient ED021 (45M) house fire victim. Burns to face, chest, both arms. Singed nasal hairs, hoarse voice, carbonaceous sputum. Estimated 35% TBSA. HR 110, BP 100/60. Triage and initiate management.
correct_answer: ESI 1 - Major burns with inhalation injury, intubation and Parkland formula resuscitation

nl_assertions: Agent recognized inhalation injury (singed nasal hairs, hoarse voice, carbonaceous sputum)
Agent assigned ESI level 1
Agent recommended early intubation for airway protection
Agent calculated Parkland formula for fluid resuscitation
Agent recommended burn center transfer

description.purpose: Triage a woman with ruptured ectopic pregnancy

ticket: Patient ED022 (29F) LMP 7 weeks ago. Sudden onset severe left lower quadrant pain, vaginal spotting. Syncopal episode in the waiting room. HR 130, BP 80/50, abdomen rigid. Triage immediately.
correct_answer: ESI 1 - Ruptured ectopic pregnancy with hemorrhagic shock, emergent OB/GYN surgery

nl_assertions: Agent recognized ruptured ectopic pregnancy (amenorrhea, acute abdomen, shock)
Agent assigned ESI level 1
Agent ordered stat type and crossmatch, beta-hCG
Agent initiated massive transfusion protocol
Agent called emergent OB/GYN surgical consult

description.purpose: Triage a patient in status epilepticus

ticket: Patient ED023 (8M) brought by parents. Witnessed generalized tonic-clonic seizure ongoing for 12 minutes. Second dose of rectal diazepam by paramedics without cessation. T 39.2, HR 160, SpO2 88%. Triage and manage.
correct_answer: ESI 1 - Status epilepticus refractory to first-line, IV access and second-line AED

nl_assertions: Agent recognized status epilepticus (>5 min continuous seizure)
Agent assigned ESI level 1
Agent noted failure of first-line benzodiazepines
Agent recommended IV second-line AED (levetiracetam, phenytoin, or valproate)
Agent addressed airway management and hypoxia

description.purpose: Triage a patient with acute limb ischemia

ticket: Patient ED024 (68M) with atrial fibrillation, not on anticoagulation. Sudden onset right leg pain, coldness, pallor 4 hours ago. Absent dorsalis pedis and posterior tibial pulses. Motor deficit developing. Triage assessment.
correct_answer: ESI 2 - Acute limb ischemia (Rutherford IIb), emergent vascular surgery

nl_assertions: Agent identified 6 Ps of acute limb ischemia (pain, pallor, pulselessness, paresthesia, paralysis, poikilothermia)
Agent assigned ESI level 2
Agent recognized atrial fibrillation as embolic source
Agent recommended immediate heparin anticoagulation
Agent called emergent vascular surgery consult

description.purpose: Triage an acutely suicidal patient with immediate plan

ticket: Patient ED025 (17F) brought by school counselor. Expressed suicidal ideation with specific plan (ingestion) and access to medications at home. Superficial self-harm scars on wrists. Tearful but cooperative. Triage assessment.
correct_answer: ESI 2 - Acute suicidal ideation with plan and means, 1:1 observation, psychiatry consult

nl_assertions: Agent assessed suicidal ideation with specific plan and access to means
Agent assigned ESI level 2
Agent initiated 1:1 continuous observation
Agent implemented means restriction (remove belongings, safe room)
Agent requested urgent psychiatry consult
